sen.j: 珣子内親王（じゅんしないしんのう、延慶 4年2月23日 （1311年3月13日） - 延元2年/建武 4年5月12日 （1337年6月11日））は後醍醐天皇の中宮。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Junshi (March 13, 1311 - June 11, 1337) was Emperor Godaigo's Chugu. (the Empress)
Imperial Princess Junshi (March 13, 1311 - June 11, 1337) was Emperor Godaigo's Chugu. (Empress)
Imperial Princess Junshi (March 13, 1311 - June 11, 1337) was Emperor Godaigo's Chugu (Empress).
sen.cmt: 括弧書きの位置を訂正しました。

sen.j: 後伏見天皇の第一皇女。
sen.e: The first Princess of Emperor Gofushimi
The first Princess of Emperor Gofushimi
The first Princess of Emperor Gofushimi
Her mother was Neishi (Yasko) SAIONJI.
Her mother was Neishi (Yasko) SAIONJI.
Her mother was Neishi (Yasuko) SAIONJI.

sen.j: 天皇の正妻の子として重く扱われた。
sen.e: She was treated importantly as Emperor's Empress's daughter.
She was treated respectfully as the Emperor's Empress's daughter.
She was treated respectfully as the Emperor's Empress's daughter.
Her Nyoingo (a title of respect given to close female relatives of the Emperor or a woman of comparable standing) was Shinmuromachiin.
Her Nyoingo (a title of respect given to close female relatives of the Emperor or a woman of comparable standing) was Shinmuromachiin.
Her Nyoingo (a title of respect given to close female relatives of the Emperor or a woman of comparable standing) was Shinmuromachiin.
She made an Imperial consort's bridal entry for Emperor Godaigo into court in 1333.
She made an Imperial consort's bridal entry for Emperor Godaigo into court in 1333.
She made an Imperial consort's bridal entry for Emperor Godaigo into court in 1333.
She gave birth to Imperial Prince Yukiko in 1335.
She gave birth to Imperial Prince Yukiko in 1335.
She gave birth to Imperial Princess Yukiko in 1335.
She died in 1337 when she was twenty seven years old.
She died in 1337 when she was twenty seven years old.
She died in 1337 when she was twenty seven years old.
